meka.core

Class PSUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • meka.core.PSUtils

  • public abstract class PSUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    PSUtils.java - Handy Utils for working with Pruned Sets. Essentially, we have a P<\code> parameter for pruning and an N<\code> parameter for reintroduction.
    Version:
    June 2014
    Author:
    Jesse Read

      • cover

        public static LabelSet[] cover(LabelSet y,
               java.util.HashMap<LabelSet,java.lang.Integer> map)
        Cover - cover 'y' completely (or as best as possible) with sets from 'map'.
        Parameters:
        y - a LabelSet, e.g., [0,2,7]
        map - a map of LabelSets to counts e.g., {[0,2,7]:39,...}
        Returns:
        the sets to cover y (or just y, if it already covers itself).

      • cover

        public static java.util.Set<LabelSet> cover(LabelSet y,
                            java.util.SortedSet<LabelSet> S,
                            java.util.Comparator cmp)

      • getAllSubsets

        public static LabelSet[] getAllSubsets(LabelSet y,
                       java.util.HashMap<LabelSet,java.lang.Integer> map)
        GetAllSubsets - Get all frequent subsets of 'y' according to 'map'.
        Parameters:
        y - a labelset, e.g., [0,2,7]
        map - a map of labelsets to counts e.g., {[0,2]:39, [2,7]:5, [2,9]:24...}
        Returns:
        the LabelSets to use to decompose y into, e.g., [[0,2],[2,7]]
        See Also:
        #cover(LabelSet,Comparator)

      • getTopNSubsets

        public static LabelSet[] getTopNSubsets(LabelSet y,
                        java.util.HashMap<LabelSet,java.lang.Integer> map,
                        int n)
        GetTopNSubsets - Don't cover all (like cover(y,map), rather only the top 'n')
        Parameters:
        y - a labelset, e.g., [0,2,7]
        map - a map of labelsets to counts e.g., {[0,2]:39, [2,7]:5, [2,9]:24...}
        n - the number of sets to take
        Returns:
        the LabelSets to use to decompose y into, e.g., [[0,2],[2,7]]
        See Also:
        #cover(LabelSet,Comparator)

      • countCombinationsSparseSubset

        public static java.util.HashMap<LabelSet,java.lang.Integer> countCombinationsSparseSubset(weka.core.Instances D,
                                                                          int[] indices)
        CountCombinationsSparseSubset - like CountCombinationsSparse, but only interested in 'indices[]' wrt 'D'.
        Parameters:
        D - dataset
        indices - indices we are interested in
        Returns:
        a HashMap where a LabelSet representation of each label combination is associated with an Integer count, e.g., [3,7,14],3

      • countCombinationsSparse

        public static final java.util.HashMap<LabelSet,java.lang.Integer> countCombinationsSparse(weka.core.Instances D,
                                                                    int L)
        CountCombinationsSparse - return a mapping of each distinct label combination and its count.
        Parameters:
        D - dataset
        L - number of labels
        Returns:
        a HashMap where a LabelSet representation of each label combination is associated with an Integer count, e.g., [3,7,14],3

      • convertDistribution

        @Deprecated
public static double[] convertDistribution(double[] p,
                                      int L,
                                      weka.core.Instances iTemplate)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert Distribution - Given the posterior across combinations, return the distribution across labels.
        Parameters:
        p[] - the posterior of the super classes (combinations), e.g., P([1,3],[2]) = [1,0]
        L - the number of labels
        Returns:
        the distribution across labels, e.g., P(1,2,3) = [1,0,1]
        See Also:
        recombination(double[],int,LabelSet[])

      • convertDistribution

        public static double[] convertDistribution(double[] p,
                           int L,
                           LabelSet[] meta_labels)
        Convert Distribution - Given the posterior across combinations, return the distribution across labels.
        Parameters:
        p[] - the posterior of the super classes (combinations), e.g., P([1,3],[2]) = [0.3,0.7]
        L - the number of labels, e.g., L = 3
        meta_labels - typical mapping, e.g., [13] to [1,3]
        Returns:
        the distribution across labels, e.g., P(1,2,3) = [0.3,0.7,0.3]

        public static final LabelSet[] makeLabelSetMap(weka.core.Instances T)

        public static final double[] recombination(double[] p,
                     int L,
                     LabelSet[] map)
        Convert Distribution - Given the posterior across combinations, return the distribution across labels.
        Parameters:
        p[] - the posterior of the super classes (combinations), e.g., P([1,3],[2]) = [1,0]
        L - the number of labels
        Returns:
        the distribution across labels, e.g., P(1,2,3) = [1,0,1]

                       weka.core.Instances iTemplate)
        Convert Distribution - Given the posterior across combinations, return the distribution across labels.
        Parameters:
        p[] - the posterior of the super classes (combinations), e.g., P([1,3],[2]) = [0.3,0.7]
        L - the number of labels
        Returns:
        the distribution across labels, e.g., P(1,2,3) = [0.3,0.7,0.3]
